section.name: Functional Requirements
section.snippet: FR-019: (MVP) The application functions on the latest stable versions of Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Mozilla Firefox, Brave, and Opera on desktop. FR-020: (MVP) The application is fully responsive across various screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).

section.name: web_app Specific Requirements - Platform Support
section.snippet: Browser Matrix: Latest stable versions of Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Mozilla Firefox, Brave, and Opera on desktop. Responsive Design: The application should be fully responsive and function well across various screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).

section.name: Epic 1: Foundation & Core Content Input
section.snippet: Goal: Establish the basic application infrastructure and allow users to provide content for processing.

section.name: Story 1.5: (MVP) Basic Browser Compatibility & Responsiveness
section.snippet: User Story: As a user, I want to access QuizZum from common web browsers and devices, so that I can use the tool without compatibility issues. Acceptance Criteria: Functions on latest desktop browsers, UI adjusts and is usable on mobile devices.

section.name: Project Initialization
section.snippet: The project will be initialized using Next.js (JavaScript), Tailwind CSS, and Headless UI.

section.name: Decision Summary
section.snippet: File Storage: Temporary/Ephemeral Storage for PDFs. API Communication: RESTful Next.js Frontend ↔ FastAPI Backend.

section.name: Technology Stack Details - Core Technologies
section.snippet: Frontend: Next.js (JavaScript), React, Tailwind CSS, Headless UI.

section.name: Consistency Rules - Testing Strategy
section.snippet: Frontend E2E Tests: For critical user flows using `Playwright` or `Cypress` to verify browser compatibility and responsive layout.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Foundation & Core Content Input

section.name: Non-Functional Requirements - Performance
section.snippet: Responsiveness: Frontend UI should remain responsive with loading indicators (NFR1).

section.name: Detailed Design - Workflows and Sequencing
section.snippet: User interaction: Frontend displays UI elements. Frontend Update: Displays UI based on responsive design.

section.name: Executive Summary
section.snippet: Platform: Initially, a responsive web application.

section.name: 3. Visual Foundation
section.snippet: Spacing and Layout Foundation: Flexible, responsive 12-column grid system will be implemented to ensure optimal content arrangement and readability across all screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).

section.name: User Journey: Generate Multi-level Summaries
section.snippet: Platform Adaptability: The entire adaptive learning experience will be dynamically scaled and optimized for seamless interaction across all screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).
